Honestly I don't think it will, we're 4 eps deep and I haven't seen much talk about it for the most part. Also doesn't help that the genre at face value isn't attractive to casual anime fans. But tbh man I'm glad about it! makes me feel a little special knowing that I and my other cultured fellows noticed this beauty of work while everyone was only focused on the mainstream stuff. This will definitely be one of those anime where later down the line people will see it as a "hidden gem" tho just bc of demon slayer and AOT getting so much (well deserved) attention. But for now I'm glad it just feels like our little secret that we can be smug about and enjoy all this peak art and animation. Only thing bad about it is ofc if it does too bad we might not get another installment of it lol which im not even sure how much source material there is and if its enough for a s2.

Bro, I don't get it.... How's this ONLY 7.57/10?

As a fan of demon slayer and also the person to like this anime, i understand your POV on why the rating is low. So cheer up, i atleast think there are more people like me, who can understand your comment âœŒï¸
Facts.
I think the opposite. I think a 7.5 is a good rating for this, and demon slayer should be way lower.
lol you sure are tough to please XD. But coming to think of it, yeah, 7.57 isn't a bad score by any means...
its a hidden gem man, lets enjoy it and not give a fuck about the rating xD
Strictly speaking, you aren't wrong. Genreally, comparing a shounen anime to a SOL anime such as this one is unfair to begin with, yet many others do so with that intention.
Ah, no, well I guess you're right about that. But I wasn't really comparing them. In fact, I was tryna show just how similar these two animes are...

The reason this anime got a lower rating than Demon Slayer is simple, just look at the amount of genres both these two animes consist. Demon Slayer has a more expanded world setting than Akebi-chan, this means more colors and variations of story exposition to use.
wooo~ ohh yeah you're right...

Slice of life without romance almost never gets a substantial audience. Romance brings the necessary spice for the average viewer to stay, Im sure if this show introduced a love interest for akebi then it would be more popular.

But that's the point that the others don't understand about this anime... This anime's very purpose itself is to display the BEAUTY of sailor uniforms, that, and only that. The problem is people asks for MORE that this anime is NOT MEANT TO GIVE.
Yeah... that's the sad truth...

A rich, all girls school where everyone is friendly and happy. Too far from reality lol

Sweets make them happy, oddities stimulate curiosity, sheltered all-girls lifestyle cultivates perversion. Nothing out of the ordinary. The too far from reality is the typical arrogant haughty behavior. I would not say its a "rich girls" school as the dorms and the like were quite worn and the lack of more technology and restrictions. - Not a poor school but a typical all-girls school for those with better grades and potentially a bit more money. Education outside of the US is competitive in nature on all levels, even at public institutions. There are the base level schools and then ones that require entrance exams and even tuition fees.
